captions.text: Hi, how are you doing?! My name is Otário (Sucker)!
And the "Civil Rights Framework for Internet in Brazil" was approved by the Chamber of Deputies!
From now on, we'll have a neutral internet, safe, without traffic shaping and companies fucking with the consumers!
Woooow, that's coooooool!
Is that so?!

The Civil Rights Framework for Internet in Brazil will be analysed
by the Senado...
And, if approved, is going to pass by the presidential sanction.

If this happen, Brazil will be the first
democratic country in the world to have a
"exclusive constitution for internet"!
The main idea used by the "Civil Rights Framework for Internet" was the defense of the Internet neutrality

Which determines that the Internet traffic
be treated equally, i.e., without discrimination
based on the content, service, application and so on.
The article 9, that explain the internet neutrality, states that:
The responsible for the transmission, commutation or routing has to treat

any data package in a isonomic way,
without distinction of content, origin and destiny,
service, terminal or application.
This means that, broadband companies (like NET and GVT) couldn't offer
the sale of plans that only allow the use of specific applications such as Facebook,
YouTube, Skype...
And be prohibited to make the use of the damn traffic shaping damn Traffic Shaping
Which is a tool very utilized by them to reduce the speed of determined internet
applications, and with this mask the poor structure of the Brazilian internet,
that beyond being expensive, it's extremely slow.
But, unfortunately, it's not just about Internet Neutrality that the Civil Rights Framework is made.
With it, there is also a lot of gaps or juridic traps that can generate
even more censorship  and invasion of privacy on the Brazilian Internet, or even, compromise
the internet neutrality itself.
Don't you believe?!
So, let's take a detailed look in the main articles approved by the
"Deputies", on 03/25/2014?!

In the same article 9, there is the following paragraph:
§ 1º The discrimination or degradation of the
traffic will be regulated in the terms of the privative attributions of the President of
the Republic foreseen in the incise IV, article 84 of the Federal Constitution, for the faithful
execution of this law, heard the Internet Gestor Committee and the National Telecommunications Agency,

and only can elapse of:
I -- indispensable technical requisites to the

adequate installment of services and applications;
and
II -- prioritization of emergency services .
Despite that, theoretically, this restricts a little the acting of the President of the Republic,
it doesn't guarantee the internet neutrality, since, it's just necessary a presidential signature to
establish some "technical" or "emergencial" exceptions.
For example, through the lobby of big companies like NET, Embratel, Claro, Oi,Tim and GVT,
the use of traffic shaping could be instituted and legalized (with a allegation
strictly "technic"), since that, due to the incompetence and the lack of the lack of investment
to amplify the structure of the Brazilian broadband, the traffic shaping would be the "best solution"
to close this hole and to avoid a complete crash in our internet.
In other words: bye, bye neutrality!
Besides, if we had more competition in the Brazilian telecommunications sector,
would we have to worry about with this kind of thing?!
Don't fuck me!
Beyond this, to establish that the President of the Republic will listen to the opinion of the CGI

or Anatel, doesn't mean anything,
even because, these institutions wouldn't have
power to stop (or to veto) a presidential decision.

And remembering that these institutions were
created by the govern itself.

I.e., hardly a dog bites the hand of its
owner, and if it does, it's punished!
In the article 13, that talks about the connection logs, that are the information refering to
data and the start and ending time of a Internet connection through a computer,

we have the following text:
Art. 13. In the internet provison,
it's up to the respective autonomous system administrator the duty to keep the connection logs
with secrecy, in a secure and controlled environment, for a period of one year,
in the terms of the regulation.
§ 1st The responsability for the maintenance of the connection logs can't be tranfered to

a third person or company.
§ 5th In any hypothesis, the availability of the
petitioner records that is about this article should be preceded by judicial
authorization, as provided in the section IV of this Chapter.
Despite this article bring a little more security to the clients' personal data,
prohibiting that provider (like NET or GVT) sell or leak these information to thirds
(withouth the consent of the person), there are some traps in it.
All Brazilian citizen will be "bugged" by the provider
(even if the providers doesn't need these information).
In other words, everyone who access the internet'll be treated as potential criminals, that need to have
their data stores by determined period to further verification.
The storing of these information should be facultative and, if the provider really need this
information, then thi data should be securely stored, prohibiting the
divulgation to others without user's previous authorization.
Beyond that, why store these information for one year?!
Why the government is so interested in keep all of the connection logs of a
whole population?!
To ask for authorization to a Judge bug a criminal that is under investigation,
is OK... but bug a whole population (regardless of fault), there is too much,
right?!
And then the government complains that is being spied by the USA!
Go fuck yourselves, dammit!

We already have TSE, that wants to store all of 
our biometric data, now they also want
to record all of our connector logs on internet?! :-/
Go fuck yourselves, your fuckers!
The connection logs to Internet applications (such as Facebook pages, Youtube, among others)
are explained in the Civil Rights Framework through the article 15
Art. 15. The provider of internet applications constituted in the form of juridical person
and that exercise this activity in a organized way professionally and with economic purposes should
maintain the respectives connection logs to internet applications, with secrecy, in a
controlled and secure environment, for the period of 6 (six) months, in the regulation terms.
Just like in the case of the connection logs,if a website doesn't need to store information
of access to its applications, so why to oblige them to do this?!
One more time, the text should become facultative the storage of these information.
And, only if the company (really) need these data, than should have the exigency of
store it in a secure and sigilous way.
Does anyone, with a little good sense, believes that a real virtual criminal will
use conventional methods to access internet applications?!
You are kidding, right?!

But not everything is this bad...
one of the positive points of Civil Rights Framework,
is the article 18, that states:
Art. 18. The provider to internet connection will not be civilly responsible
for damage caused by thirds.

What is excellent!
After all, make responsible companies like Google,
Facebook, Twitter or any other else by the content produced by thirds, would be
the same that condemn a company that fabricates hammers, for the murder committed
by a criminal that used this hammer to kill somebody!
Would be ridiculous, right?!
But after it, in the article 19, we have the following text:
Art. 19. With the intention to assure the liberty of expression and to impede the censorship, the internet
applications provider can only be civilly responsible for damage of content
generated by thirds if, after specific judicial order, don't
make the arrangements, in the ambit and inthe technical limits of its service and inside
the adjusted period, become unavailable the content signed as infringement, except for
the legal dispositions in otherwise.
Now, how can Youtube, for example, be able to remove all of the content copies

considered as infringements?!
Thousands and thousands of users can
repost videos censured by the Justice every day. In these cases, who would be the culprits,
the users or the YouTube that couldn't be faster than the uploads?!
The result of this could be that, some companies, with apprehension to be punished,
could censor content in a undiscriminated way, just to avoid possible judicial
fights.
In others words, goodbye freedom of expression!
But wait, nothing is so bad that can't be even worst!
In this same article 19, there are two paragraphs that states the following:
§ 3rd The causes that are about indemnification due to damage elapsing of content available
on internet related to honor, to reputation or to personality rights as well as to the
unavailability of these contents by the internet applications provider can be
presented before the special courts.
§ 4th The judge, included in the procedure foreseen  in the § 3rd, can anticipate, totally or partially,
the effects of the tutelage intended in the initial request, existing unequivocal proof of this
fact and considered the interest of collectivity in the disponibilization of the content on the internet,
since that present requirements of verisimilitude of the author of the allegation and of well-founded fear
of irreparable damage or of difficult reparation.
In these paragraphs there is a huge gap to the censorship, since that any magistrate of a
Special Court (where a lawyer is not necessary) would have the decision power,
with immediate effect, to censor a content on the internet.
So?! You couldn't understand the size of the problem?!
So I'll give you a practical example, imagine that I made a video on YouTube where I talk
about determined politician or president of a company.
So, this person goes to a Special Court, saying that I would be denigrating its picture

or honor.
The Judge, of the Special Court, with an allegation
that it coulld have irreparable damage or of hard reparation, could request
the immediate removal of my video, even before I bring a lawsuit recur of the decision in a
superior instance.
And now, did you understand the danger of a clause like this?!
Without counting that, what it would be a "Apprehension of irreparable or hardly reparable damage"?!

- By chance, is there a worst damage than the death?!
Even with it, there are laws that establish
values and periodos for that a murderer accomplish its penalty and repair the damage caused.
- Why a simple text, picture or internet video would need a special treatment or of a

special censorship service?!
Don't fuck with me
And in this example, I cited a YouTube video, but this could happen in any blog post
social media, or even in news websites!
- So?! This gap is or isn't an direct attack to the freedom of expression?!
Therefore, beyond the modifications shown on the previous articles, we have to claim that
the whole article 19 be removed (or, at least, the paragraphs 3 and 4)
The idea of the Civil Rights Framework as a whole, is not bad. But poorly written laws, such as Marco
Civil, serves more like a curse than a gift, to fuck even more the life of the Brazilian
population.
You wanna know what you can do to make it better?!
In addition to share this video, in the description,  there is a link with the phone and the

email of all the senators.
Get in touch with them! Let's press so that they
modify these articles that transformed the Civil Rights Framework in a Trojan Horse.
[---  Translation Vitor Utrila --]

comments.text:
Rs... como se todos os aspectos da vida precisassem de regulamentação. Mais 
um pouco e esses fdp vão querer decidir como eu devo cagar também: dirão 
que realizaram alguns debates públicos e chegaram a conclusão de que para 
se cagar com eficiência deve-se fazê-lo deitado, de ladinho, e a merda deve 
ser retirada com a mão, já que a contração abdominal leva ao aparecimento 
de hemorróidas e isso caracteriza um preocupante caso de saúde pública. 
Qualquer semelhança não é mera coincidência.
A internet é um ambiente livre que não carece de porra de constituição 
nenhuma. Um projeto parecido com esse do Marco Civil foi apresentado na 
Europa e adivinhem, foi REJEITADO por representar um perigo a liberdade de 
expressão. Não é a toa que não existe regulamentação em países que prestem 
- essas bucetagens só pegam por aqui mesmo.

O melhor momento pra revogação dessa porra de artigo 19 é agora, já que na 
bancada a maioria é de oposição. Vale lembrar que o autor da proposta é 
Alessandro Molon, PeTralha de RJ.﻿

comments.author: Garcia Daniel

comments.text:
Toda essa polêmica sobre o Marco Civil é mais exagero que verdade, a 
maioria das medidas presentes na lei já eram aplicadas por construções 
jurisprudenciais e adaptação do código civil. O exemplo do art. 19, §§ 3º e 
4º mostra bem isso, pois mesmo antes do marco civil qualquer pessoa poderia 
fazer o mesmo pedido, sem advogado e o juiz poderia mandar retirar o 
conteúdo publicado da mesma forma, sem a norma específica. O nome dessa 
medida é tutela antecipada, art. 273, do CPC e isso não é censura, mas sim 
preservação de um direito que pode perecer ao longo do processo.﻿

comments.author: GS Muggue

comments.text:
E é engraçado como nunca mudaram os livros e as livrarias que conheço desde 
68!!! Apesar da censura até 88, nunca tiveram a ousadia de fazer um Marco 
Zero das publicações e  o que se deve vender em sebos e livrarias! E temos 
títulos bem pornográficos, sacanas e censuráveis e ninguem lê mesmo - 
segundo uma teoria política sobre a pobreza da linguagem e dos livros que 
NINGUEM lê mesmo...Uma pôrra de Governo e uma política odiosa sempre a 
mesma, desde priscas eras!!! PQP!﻿
comments.author: Francisco Carlos Amado

comments.text:
Já manipularam a TV Aberta, a TV a Cabo ( que tá uma merda Brazilinesca e 
medíocre!), a língua Portupresa (!), os telefones celulares, os correios e 
as revistas de banca! FODA MEU! Isso já dura há décadas, desde 75 quando a 
Globo já se achava profissional, metida a besta e coisa e tal...
Quando uma coisa é boa lá fora lá vem Brazucas com péssimas intenções para 
estragar o melhor da mídia! Nada se pode fazer a não ser desligar a TV e 
ignorar a Internet...PHODA BRAZYL!﻿
comments.author: Francisco Carlos Amado
